1.text: But you are to speak the things that befit sound doctrine.

2.text: Old men should be sober, chaste, prudent, sound in faith, in love, in patience.

3.text: Old women, similarly, should be in holy attire, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teaching well,

4.text: so that they may teach prudence to the young women, so that they may love their husbands, love their children,

5.text: be sensible, chaste, restrained, have concern for the household, be kind, be subordinate to their husbands: so that the Word of God may be not blasphemed.

6.text: Exhort young men similarly, so that they may show self-restraint.

7.text: In all things, present yourself as an example of good works: in doctrine, with integrity, with seriousness,

8.text: with sound words, irreproachably, so that he who is an opponent may dread that he has nothing evil to say about us.

9.text: Exhort servants to be submissive to their masters, in all things pleasing, not contradicting,

10.text: not cheating, but in all things showing good fidelity, so that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Savior in all things.

11.text: For the grace of God our Savior has appeared to all men,

12.text: instructing us to reject impiety and worldly desires, so that we may live soberly and justly and piously in this age,

13.text: looking forward to the blessed hope and the advent of the glory of the great God and of our Savior Jesus Christ.

14.text: He gave himself for our sake, so that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and might cleanse for himself an acceptable people, pursuers of good works.

15.text: Speak and exhort and argue these things with all authority. Let no one despise you.
